newsitem.title: FRANCE: Canal Plus sees stable full year profit.
newsitem.headline: Canal Plus sees stable full year profit.

text.p: French pay television group Canal Plus said on Tuesday it expected its full year 1996 net attributable profit to be at least equal to that of 1995, after it reported a 16.6 percent increase in first half profits.

Canal Plus said in a statement its net attributable profit for the first half rose to 386 million francs from 331 million last year. In 1995, the group posted a full year net attributable figure of 665.8 million.

"The good financial and commercial health of the parent company, the improvement of the contribution of foreign subsidiaries and the turnaround of the situation at Studio Canal Plus should continue in the second half," Canal Plus said.

"However, while the start-up costs of the digital services in April only affect two months of the first half results, they will in full on the second half. Taking account of these various elements and the seasonality of our sales, the group Canal Plus expects for 1996 a net attributable figure at least equal to that of 1995," it added.

Sales increased by 8.3 percent to 5.44 billion francs and Canal Plus said that the launch of digital services had boosted the number of subscribers to Canalsatellite by 85 percent to a level "much higher than our initial estimates."
It said that its French television unit saw its operating margin rise to 26.1 percent from 21.2 percent a year ago.
Canal Plus took a 31 million exceptional charge to provision against the risk of "certain participations".
It said its cash flow was 1,445 million francs. Net cash stood at 1.9 billion at June 30 and the share capital at about eight billion francs.
